title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: validation system tenzing consists three main components: ColumnValidator ‚Äì Ensures required columns exist contributors table. Validator ‚Äì Runs logical checks contents table (e.g., missing values, duplicate names). ValidateOutput ‚Äì Combines column data validation, allowing customized validation pipelines using YAML configuration files. leveraging components, can create validation rules check specific issues data.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: Validation rules written functions tenzing. functions take contributors_table input return list two elements: type: Can ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù, ‚Äúwarning‚Äù, ‚Äúerror‚Äù, indicating result check. message: user-friendly explanation check result.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: Let‚Äôs say want create check ensures every contributor valid ORCID ID.
code: #' Check for valid ORCID IDs #' #' This function checks if the ORCID IDs in the `contributors_table` are formatted correctly. #' #' @param contributors_table A dataframe containing the contributors' information. #' #' @return A list containing: #' \item{type}{Type of validation result: "success", "warning", or "error".} #' \item{message}{An informative message indicating if any ORCID IDs are invalid.} check_orcid <- function(contributors_table) {   if (!"ORCID" %in% colnames(contributors_table)) {     return(list(       type = "warning",       message = "No ORCID column found. ORCID validation skipped."     ))   }      invalid_orcids <- contributors_table %>%     dplyr::filter(!grepl("^\\d{4}-\\d{4}-\\d{4}-\\d{4}$", .data$ORCID) & !is.na(.data$ORCID))      if (nrow(invalid_orcids) > 0) {     return(list(       type = "warning",       message = glue::glue("Invalid ORCID format for the following rows: {paste(invalid_orcids$rowname, collapse = ', ')}")     ))   }      return(list(type = "success", message = "All ORCID IDs are correctly formatted.")) }

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: tenzing uses clean, consistent configuration system validation files follow structure: General column validation: column_validation.yaml comprehensive column checking Output-specific validation: Files like title_validation.yaml specific output types Consistent structure: configs use column_config validation_config sections Easy customization: can create custom configurations extend existing ones tenzing includes set predefined validation helpers R/validate_helpers.R. include: - check_missing_order ‚Äì Ensures contributors order publication. - check_duplicate_order ‚Äì Ensures duplicate order numbers unless multiple first authors exist. - check_missing_surname ‚Äì Ensures contributors surname. - check_duplicate_names ‚Äì Ensures duplicate contributor names. - check_affiliation_consistency ‚Äì Ensures one affiliation format used. - Many ‚Ä¶ functions automatically available setting validation tenzing.

Key Features Validator: loads validation functions explicitly validate_helpers.R, ensuring work environments. allows adding dependencies validation rules. executes specified validations configuration. supports context-aware validation dynamic UI states.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: ColumnValidator class ensures necessary columns present running validations. Key Features ColumnValidator: Supports logical operators: , , column requirements. Supports regex patterns dynamically named columns. Supports severity levels: error warning.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: ValidateOutput class integrates ColumnValidator Validator single, easy--use interface. Key Features ValidateOutput: Automatically runs column validation data validation. Returns column validation errors critical columns missing. Supports optional context parameters dynamic validation.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: ColumnValidator class ensures necessary columns present running validations.

title: Custom Validation in tenzing
text: Let‚Äôs examine column validation rules title configuration: configuration defines several rules: minimal_rule: Requires basic contributor information (Firstname, Middle name, Surname, Order publication) operator (must present). affiliation_rule: Requires least one affiliation column (using operator) supports legacy columns (Primary affiliation, Secondary affiliation) regex-based columns matching ^Affiliation [0-9]+$. title_rule: Requires corresponding author information (Corresponding author? Email address must present).
code: config_path <- system.file("config/title_validation.yaml", package = "tenzing") config <- yaml::read_yaml(config_path)  # View the column rules config$column_config$rules #> $minimal_rule #> $minimal_rule$operator #> [1] "AND" #>  #> $minimal_rule$columns #> [1] "Firstname"            "Middle name"          "Surname"              #> [4] "Order in publication" #>  #> $minimal_rule$severity #> [1] "error" #>  #>  #> $affiliation_rule #> $affiliation_rule$operator #> [1] "OR" #>  #> $affiliation_rule$columns #> [1] "Primary affiliation"   "Secondary affiliation" #>  #> $affiliation_rule$regex #> [1] "^Affiliation [0-9]+$" #>  #> $affiliation_rule$severity #> [1] "error" #>  #>  #> $title_rule #> $title_rule$operator #> [1] "AND" #>  #> $title_rule$columns #> [1] "Corresponding author?" "Email address"         #>  #> $title_rule$severity #> [1] "warning"

title: Generate report of the contributions with CRedit ‚Äî print_credit_roles
text: contributors_table Tibble. Validated contributors_table text_format Character. Formatting returned string. Possible values: "rmd", "html", "raw". "rmd" default. initials Logical. true initials included instead full names output order_by Character. Whether contributing authors listed role ("role"), roles listed name contributor ("contributor"). include Character. Filter people include: "author" (keep rows Author/Acknowledgee == "Author") "acknowledgment" (keep rows Author/Acknowledgee == "Acknowledgment ") Rows "agree named" always excluded. pub_order Character. "asc" (default) "desc" Order publication. include_orcid Logical. TRUE, append ORCID information contributor names (badges HTML/Rmd, plain text raw output). Defaults FALSE. orcid_style Character. ORCID inclusion enabled, choose "badge" (default) render ORCID icon link, "text" render normalized ORCID URL parentheses name.

FALSE (default), returns contributor-related XML fragments (<contrib-group>, <aff>, <funding-group>, <author-notes>) can embedded existing JATS document. include_acknowledgees Logical. TRUE, includes contributors "Acknowledgment " Author/Acknowledgee column separate <contrib-group content-type="acknowledgees"> section. Defaults FALSE. include_orcid Logical. TRUE (default), includes ORCID IDs XML output <contrib-id contrib-id-type="orcid"> elements. FALSE, ORCID IDs excluded output.

text: Added option include acknowledged contributors want named paper contributors table. Contributor statements now generated separately acknowledgees authors. Acknowledgees now listed JATS 1.3 XML output affiliations CRediT roles. Funding conflict interest statements now included JATS 1.3 XML output. Full article JATS 1.3 XML can optionally generated mock data output can validated J4R Validator: https://jats4r-validator.niso.org/. ORCID iDs can included unauthorized ORCID badge (hyperlink) plain text contributors statement, title page, JATS 1.3 XML outputs. Added additional conditional validators new outputs. Added additional validation helpers creating exploring validation config files. Added opportunities customize outputs toggle switches.
